thread.title: Blue Jays World Series tickets go on sale this morning
thread.title_full: Blue Jays World Series tickets go on sale this morning | Toronto Star

author: Jillian Kestler-D’Amours
title: Blue Jays World Series tickets go on sale this morning
text:
Toronto baseball fans will have two wishes when World Series tickets go on sale later this morning: the first is to get their hands on one – and then for the Blue Jays to actually make it there.
Tickets to the MLB’s most important series go on sale to the general public at 10 a.m. today.
Prices range from $160 tp $1,400 a seat, the costliest of any Jays’ playoff tickets so far this season. They can be purchased online and by phone and you can buy up to four at a time.
But you’ll need to have a little luck to get your hands on one of these golden tickets: ALCS seats were sold out in about an hour earlier this month, and tickets for the ALDS were gone in a little under two hours .
The Jays are riding high off their 7-1 win over the Royals on Wednesday night as they head back to Kansas City for Game 6 on Friday trailing 3-2 in the series.
They need two more wins on the road to move on to the World Series for the first time in 22 years. “It’s possible. And that’s how we’re looking at it. Win the next game. Get to Game 7 and anything can happen,” Troy Tulowitzki said after Game 5 .
The Jays would play the New York Mets for the pennant, after New York pulled the plug on the Chicago Cubs’ playoff hopes on Wednesday with an 8-3 win at Wrigley Field.
If the Jays don’t make it, ticketholders will get a full refund.
